studyDesigns.name: Study Design
studyDesigns.rationale: Protocol-defined study design for investigating efficacy and safety

arms.name: BIVV009 Treatment Arm
arms.description: All participants receive BIVV009 IV infusion. Dosing is based on body weight: 6.5g for <75kg or 7.5g for ≥75kg. Dosing schedule: Day 0, Day 7, and then every 14 days thereafter.

studyCohorts.name: Primary CAgD with recent transfusion
studyCohorts.characteristic: Patients with primary cold agglutinin disease who have a history of at least one documented blood transfusion within 6 months of enrollment.

studyElements.name: BIVV009 Treatment Arm - Screening/Observation Period
studyElements.description: Treatment period for BIVV009 Treatment Arm during Screening/Observation Period

studyElements.name: BIVV009 Treatment Arm - Part A Treatment Phase
studyElements.description: Treatment period for BIVV009 Treatment Arm during Part A Treatment Phase

studyElements.name: BIVV009 Treatment Arm - Part B Extension Phase
studyElements.description: Treatment period for BIVV009 Treatment Arm during Part B Extension Phase

studyElements.name: BIVV009 Treatment Arm - Safety Follow-up
studyElements.description: Treatment period for BIVV009 Treatment Arm during Safety Follow-up

maskingRoles.text: This is an Open Label study with no masking

population.name: Study Population
population.description: Target population defined by eligibility criteria

objectives.name: Primary Objective (Part A)
objectives.text: To determine whether BIVV009 administration results in a ≥2 g/dL increase in hemoglobin (Hgb) levels or increases Hgb to ≥12 g/dL and obviates the need for blood transfusion during treatment in patients with primary CAgD who have a recent history of blood transfusion.

objectives.name: Secondary Efficacy Objective (Part A)
objectives.text: To assess the effect of BIVV009 on clinical events and laboratory parameters related to hemolysis and anemia in patients with primary CAgD

objectives.name: Secondary Quality of Life Objective (Part A)
objectives.text: To assess the effect of BIVV009 on quality of life (QOL) in patients with primary CAgD

objectives.name: Secondary Safety Objective (Part A)
objectives.text: To evaluate the overall safety and tolerability of BIVV009 in patients with primary CAgD

objectives.name: Exploratory Objective (Part A) - Complications
objectives.text: To assess the effect of BIVV009 on specific complications of CAgD (acrocyanosis, Raynaud’s syndrome, hemoglobinuria, and thromboembolism)

objectives.name: Exploratory Objective (Part A) - Biomarkers
objectives.text: To evaluate the effect of BIVV009 on certain disease-related biomarkers in patients with primary CAgD

objectives.name: Exploratory Objective (Part A) - Pharmacokinetics
objectives.text: To evaluate the pharmacokinetics of BIVV009

objectives.name: Exploratory Objective (Part A) - Immunogenicity
objectives.text: To evaluate the immunogenicity of BIVV009

objectives.name: Primary Objective (Part B)
objectives.text: The primary objective of Part B is to evaluate the long-term safety and tolerability of BIVV009 in patients with primary CAgD.

objectives.name: Secondary Objective (Part B)
objectives.text: The secondary objective of Part B is to investigate the durability of response during long-term treatment with BIVV009 in patients with primary CAgD.

objectives.name: Exploratory Objective (Part B) - Home Infusion
objectives.text: To describe the safety and patient satisfaction with the convenience of home infusions with BIVV009 in a subset of patients

endpoints.name: Primary Efficacy Endpoint (Part A)
endpoints.text: The primary efficacy endpoint is the responder rate as defined in Table 2 (≥2 g/dL increase in Hgb or Hgb ≥12 g/dL and no transfusion from Week 5 to 26).

endpoints.name: Secondary Efficacy Endpoint - Bilirubin
endpoints.text: Mean change from baseline in bilirubin (excluding patients with Gilbert’s Syndrome) at the treatment assessment endpoint

endpoints.name: Secondary Efficacy Endpoint - FACIT-Fatigue
endpoints.text: Mean change from baseline in QOL, as assessed by the change in Functional Assessment of Chronic Illness Therapy (FACIT)-Fatigue scale scores at the treatment assessment endpoint

endpoints.name: Secondary Efficacy Endpoint - LDH
endpoints.text: Mean change from baseline in lactate dehydrogenase (LDH) at the treatment assessment endpoint

endpoints.name: Secondary Efficacy Endpoint - Transfusions
endpoints.text: Number of transfusions and number of units after the first 5 weeks of study drug administration

endpoints.name: Secondary Efficacy Endpoint - Hgb
endpoints.text: Mean change from baseline in Hgb at the treatment assessment endpoint

endpoints.name: Exploratory Efficacy Endpoint - Time to Transfusion
endpoints.text: Time to first transfusion after the first 5 weeks of study drug administration

endpoints.name: Exploratory Efficacy Endpoint - EQ-5D-5L
endpoints.text: Mean change from baseline in QOL, as assessed by the change in the five level EuroQol - five dimensions questionnaire (EQ-5D-5L) scores at the treatment assessment endpoint

endpoints.name: Exploratory Efficacy Endpoint - SF-12
endpoints.text: Mean change from baseline in QOL, as assessed by the change in the 12-Item Short Form Survey (SF-12®) at the end of treatment assessment endpoint

endpoints.name: Exploratory Efficacy Endpoint - Symptomatic Anemia
endpoints.text: Incidence of solicited symptomatic anemia at EOT

endpoints.name: Exploratory Efficacy Endpoint - Hgb Threshold
endpoints.text: Proportion of patients with Hgb level of ≥12 g/dL at the treatment assessment endpoint

endpoints.name: Exploratory Efficacy Endpoint - Thromboembolism
endpoints.text: Incidence of thromboembolic events after the first 5 weeks of study drug administration

endpoints.name: Exploratory Efficacy Endpoint - Normalization Time
endpoints.text: Median time to normalization of bilirubin, LDH, and haptoglobin

endpoints.name: Exploratory Efficacy Endpoint - Haptoglobin Normalization
endpoints.text: Proportion of patients normalizing haptoglobin at the treatment assessment endpoint

endpoints.name: Exploratory Efficacy Endpoint - Bilirubin Normalization
endpoints.text: Proportion of patients normalizing bilirubin at the treatment assessment endpoint

endpoints.name: Exploratory Efficacy Endpoint - LDH Normalization
endpoints.text: Proportion of patients normalizing LDH at the treatment assessment endpoint

endpoints.name: Exploratory Efficacy Endpoint - PGIC
endpoints.text: Patient’s Global Impression of Change (PGIC) to assess patient’s perception of changes in CAgD disease burden at EOT

endpoints.name: Exploratory Efficacy Endpoint - PGIS
endpoints.text: Patient’s Global Impression of [Fatigue] Severity (PGIS) to assess patient’s perception of changes in fatigue at EOT

endpoints.name: Exploratory Efficacy Endpoint - Circulatory Symptoms
endpoints.text: Incidence of disabling circulatory symptoms at EOT

endpoints.name: Exploratory Efficacy Endpoint - Resource Utilization
endpoints.text: Total healthcare resource utilization at EOT

endpoints.name: Safety Outcome Measures - General
endpoints.text: Adverse events (AEs), serious AEs, clinical laboratory evaluations, SLE panel, vital sign measurements, electrocardiograms (ECGs), physical examination findings, and serum disease-related biomarkers.

endpoints.name: Safety Outcome Measures - Hemolytic Breakthrough
endpoints.text: Hemolytic breakthrough (rapid fall in Hgb ≥2 g/dL associated with an increase in LDH/bilirubin and/or decrease in haptoglobin since the last scheduled visit) through the EOT at Week 26

endpoints.name: Safety Outcome Measures - Infections
endpoints.text: Infections of ≥ Grade 3 severity (ie, requiring IV antibiotics)

endpoints.name: Safety Outcome Measures - Home Infusion
endpoints.text: For patients with home infusions, safety assessments will additionally include AEs with onset within 24 hours of the infusion

endpoints.name: Pharmacokinetic Endpoint - Concentration
endpoints.text: Plasma concentrations of BIVV009

endpoints.name: Pharmacokinetic Endpoint - Parameters
endpoints.text: PK parameters. Appropriate exposure parameters (Cmax, AUC) will be derived using a population approach.

endpoints.name: Pharmacodynamic Primary Outcome Measure
endpoints.text: Wieslab-CP

endpoints.name: Exploratory Complement System Measures
endpoints.text: CH50, Total C4, C1q, C1s

endpoints.name: Immunogenicity Outcome Measures
endpoints.text: Pre-existing ADA and treatment-emergent ADA

endpoints.name: Home Infusion Satisfaction
endpoints.text: Satisfaction with home infusion after first home infusion and after four home infusion will be assessed in patients with home infusion

exits.name: Early Withdrawal Non-Responder
exits.description: Any patient withdrawing after Week 5 and prior to Week 23 is a non-responder and ineligible for Part B.

exits.name: Study Completion
exits.description: Part B runs for 2 years following last patient out (LPO) under Part A.

notes.text: a. The 6-week Screening/Observation Period may be extended by 1 week for patients requiring a blood transfusion prior to study drug administration.

b. Patients should return to the site 9 weeks after last dose for ET procedures, EOS assessment, or Safety Follow-up procedures upon completion of dosing in the study. If patient experiences a hematological breakthrough event, a PK, PD, and ADA sample should be collected at the time of the event.

c. Applicable to patients who do not have documented vaccination against encapsulated bacterial pathogens within 5 years of enrollment. Refer to immunization recommendations per Section 6.1.1.1 for patients requiring vaccination. A blood sample for vaccine titers will be collected on Day 0 prior to study drug infusion to be used to determine serum relevant antibody titers should the patient be diagnosed with an infection associated with an encapsulated organism during the course of the study. A second sample will be collected during the study period if a patient presents with symptoms concerning for an infection with Streptococcus pneumoniae, Neisseria meningitidis or Haemophilus influenzae and analyzed if the infection is confirmed with one of the aforementioned organisms.

d. Prior bone marrow biopsy report review, prior tissue assessment, or new bone marrow biopsy (as applicable). Sites will submit de-identified biopsy reports to independent central reader for eligibility adjudication. If biopsy is deemed unsuitable or insufficient to determine eligibility, either prior tissue may be submitted for additional hematopathology assessment or a new bone marrow biopsy will be performed during the screening period.

e. Females of child-bearing potential only. Serum pregnancy test to be performed at Screening. Serum or urine pregnancy test to be performed on Days 0, 21, 49, 77, 105, 133, and 161, and at Week 26/EOT or at the ET Visit. Repeat serum or urine pregnancy test every 4 weeks (±2 days) during Part B.
f. Height measured at Screening only. Body weight measured every 3 months during Part B.

g. Vital signs measurements (supine BP, PR, RR, and oral temperature) are to be obtained at Screening and at each subsequent visit, with measurements performed predose and 1 hour (±5 minutes) after completion of administration of each dose of study drug.
h. For a complete list of analytes, see protocol (Section 10.1, Appendix A).

i. BIVV009 doses of 6.5 grams (if <75 kg) or 7.5 grams (if ≥75 kg) based on patient's baseline body weight will be administered via IV infusion over ~60 ±5 minutes on Days 0, 7, and every 14 days thereafter during Part A, and every 2 weeks starting at Week 27 during Part B. Patients with underlying cardiopulmonary disease may receive a 2-hour infusion with Sponsor approval. If a patient misses a scheduled dose (outside of the 2-day window or >17 days since last dose), they must return to site (unscheduled visit) to receive another loading dose 1 week prior to the next scheduled dose. Qualifying patients at participating sites may have study drug dosed at home during certain visits in Part B, according to the rules specified in Section 10.10 Appendix J (US, the Netherlands, Norway, France, Italy, Austria, Germany, Spain, and specific amendments.

j. During Part A, PK and PD samples will be collected at predose and 1 hour (±15 minutes) postdose (ie, 1 hour after completion of study drug infusion) from all patients on Days 0, 7, 21, 35, 49, 63, 77, 91, 105, 119, 133, 147, 161, and 175. An additional blood sample for PK and PD analysis will be collected during the EOT visit on Day 182 or at ET if a patient withdraws early. During Part B, PK and PD samples will be collected routinely at 3-month intervals during the 1st year of treatment in Part B, and then at 6-month intervals. PK and PD samples will also be collected if a patient experiences a hematologic breakthrough event at any point during the study.
k. AEs will be recorded from the time the patient signs the informed consent form until 9 weeks after administration of the last dose of study drug.
l. To be performed every 3 months.
m. Refer to the Laboratory Manual for details of sample collection during Screening.
n. Samples will be collected for a subset of the disease-related biomarkers at Day 91 only. Refer to the Laboratory Manual for details.
o. During Part B, a 12-lead ECG will be conducting pre- and postdose at 3 months (Day 273).
p. During Part B, the healthcare resource utilization data will be recorded every 4 weeks.
q. To be performed in the following order: FACIT-Fatigue first, PGIS second, PGIC third, SF-12 fourth, and EQ-5D-5L fifth.

r. During Part B, ADA samples will be collected at predose at 3-month intervals during the 1st year of treatment in Part B and then at 6-month intervals and at safety follow up visit 9 weeks after last dose. Samples will also be collected if a patient experiences a hematologic breakthrough event or withdraws from the study early.
s. SLE panel will be performed every 6 months in Part-B of the study.

t. In Part B, hematology and clinical chemistry panels to be performed every 2 weeks after Week 25 and up to Week 79. For the remainder of Part B after Week 79, hematology and clinical chemistry panels to be performed every 4 weeks.
u. To be performed at 3-month intervals during the 1st year of treatment in Part B, and then at 6-month intervals.
h. For a complete list of analytes, see protocol (Section 10.1, Appendix A).
l. To be performed every 3 months.
m. Refer to the Laboratory Manual for details of sample collection during Screening.
u. To be performed at 3-month intervals during the 1st year of treatment in Part B, and then at 6-month intervals.

analysisPopulations.name: Full Analysis Set
analysisPopulations.text: The Full Analysis Set (FAS) is defined as all subjects who received at least one dose of study drug (BIVV009). The FAS will be the primary population for the efficacy analysis.
analysisPopulations.label: FAS
analysisPopulations.populationDescription: The Full Analysis Set (FAS) is defined as all subjects who received at least one dose of study drug (BIVV009). The FAS will be the primary population for the efficacy analysis.

analysisPopulations.name: Per-protocol Set
analysisPopulations.text: The Per-protocol (PP) Set is a subset of the FAS and will include those subjects who completed the 26-week treatment period and did not have any major protocol deviations that would impact the primary efficacy endpoint.
analysisPopulations.label: PP
analysisPopulations.populationDescription: The Per-protocol (PP) Set is a subset of the FAS and will include those subjects who completed the 26-week treatment period and did not have any major protocol deviations that would impact the primary efficacy endpoint.
analysisPopulations.criteria: Subset of FAS AND completed 26-week treatment AND no major protocol deviations impacting primary endpoint

analysisPopulations.name: Safety Analysis Set
analysisPopulations.text: The Safety Analysis Set is defined as all subjects who received at least one dose of study drug. This population will be used for all safety analyses.
analysisPopulations.label: SAF
analysisPopulations.populationDescription: The Safety Analysis Set is defined as all subjects who received at least one dose of study drug. This population will be used for all safety analyses.

analysisPopulations.name: PK Analysis Set
analysisPopulations.text: The PK Analysis Set is defined as all subjects who received at least one dose of study drug and have at least one evaluable PK sample.
analysisPopulations.label: PK
analysisPopulations.populationDescription: The PK Analysis Set is defined as all subjects who received at least one dose of study drug and have at least one evaluable PK sample.
analysisPopulations.criteria: Received >=1 dose of study drug AND has >=1 evaluable PK sample

analysisPopulations.name: PD Analysis Set
analysisPopulations.text: The PD Analysis Set is defined as all subjects who received at least one dose of study drug and have at least one evaluable PD sample.
analysisPopulations.label: PD
analysisPopulations.populationDescription: The PD Analysis Set is defined as all subjects who received at least one dose of study drug and have at least one evaluable PD sample.
analysisPopulations.criteria: Received >=1 dose of study drug AND has >=1 evaluable PD sample

footnoteConditions.text: c. Applicable to patients who do not have documented vaccination against encapsulated bacterial pathogens within 5 years of enrollment. Refer to immunization recommendations per Section 6.1.1.1 for patients requiring vaccination. A blood sample for vaccine titers will be collected on Day 0 prior to study drug infusion to be used to determine serum relevant antibody titers should the patient be diagnosed with an infection associated with an encapsulated organism during the course of the study. A second sample will be collected during the study period if a patient presents with symptoms concerning for an infection with Streptococcus pneumoniae, Neisseria meningitidis or Haemophilus influenzae and analyzed if the infection is confirmed with one of the aforementioned organisms.

footnoteConditions.text: i. BIVV009 doses of 6.5 grams (if <75 kg) or 7.5 grams (if ≥75 kg) based on patient's baseline body weight will be administered via IV infusion over ~60 ±5 minutes on Days 0, 7, and every 14 days thereafter during Part A, and every 2 weeks starting at Week 27 during Part B. Patients with underlying cardiopulmonary disease may receive a 2-hour infusion with Sponsor approval. If a patient misses a scheduled dose (outside of the 2-day window or >17 days since last dose), they must return to site (unscheduled visit) to receive another loading dose 1 week prior to the next scheduled dose. Qualifying patients at participating sites may have study drug dosed at home during certain visits in Part B, according to the rules specified in Section 10.10 Appendix J (US, the Netherlands, Norway, France, Italy, Austria, Germany, Spain, and specific amendments.
footnoteConditions.sourceText: i. BIVV009 doses of 6.5 grams (if <75 kg) or 7.5 grams (if ≥75 kg) based on patient's baseline body

footnoteConditions.text: j. During Part A, PK and PD samples will be collected at predose and 1 hour (±15 minutes) postdose (ie, 1 hour after completion of study drug infusion) from all patients on Days 0, 7, 21, 35, 49, 63, 77, 91, 105, 119, 133, 147, 161, and 175. An additional blood sample for PK and PD analysis will be collected during the EOT visit on Day 182 or at ET if a patient withdraws early. During Part B, PK and PD samples will be collected routinely at 3-month intervals during the 1st year of treatment in Part B, and then at 6-month intervals. PK and PD samples will also be collected if a patient experiences a hematologic breakthrough event at any point during the study.

endpointAlgorithms.name: Primary: Efficacy Response (Part A)
endpointAlgorithms.algorithm: (Hb_increase >= 2 g/dL OR Hb >= 12 g/dL) AND (no_transfusions_from_week_5_to_26) AND (no_prohibited_CAD_treatments)
endpointAlgorithms.successCriteria: Hb increase ≥ 2 g/dL from baseline or Hb ≥ 12 g/dL at treatment assessment with no transfusions from Week 5 through Week 26
endpointAlgorithms.sourceText: The primary efficacy endpoint is the proportion of patients who respond to BIVV009. A responder is defined as a patient who meets the following criteria: Hb increase ≥ 2 g/dL from baseline or Hb ≥ 12

endpointAlgorithms.name: Secondary: Immunogenicity of BIVV009
endpointAlgorithms.algorithm: Count of subjects with positive Anti-Drug Antibodies (ADA) / Total subjects
endpointAlgorithms.sourceText: Secondary Exploratory Objective for Part A was added: To evaluate the immunogenicity of BIVV009.

endpointAlgorithms.name: Exploratory: Home Infusion Satisfaction (Part B)
endpointAlgorithms.algorithm: Score at 4th infusion - Score at 1st infusion
endpointAlgorithms.successCriteria: Assessment of patient satisfaction with convenience of home infusion
endpointAlgorithms.sourceText: Part B Satisfaction with home infusion after first home infusion and after four home infusion will be assessed in patients with home infusion was added.

endpointAlgorithms.name: Safety: Home Infusion Adverse Events
endpointAlgorithms.successCriteria: Identification of treatment-emergent adverse events within 24 hours of home administration
endpointAlgorithms.sourceText: For patients with home infusions, safety assessments include AEs with onset within 24 hours of infusion was added.

derivedVariables.name: Baseline Body Weight

derivedVariables.name: Dose Group Assignment
derivedVariables.derivationRule: If weight < 75 kg then 6.5 g; If weight >= 75 kg then 7.5 g (implied by weight-based fixed dosing logic)

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Age requirement
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Adult males and females ≥18 years of age at Screening.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Body weight
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Body weight of ≥39 kg at Screening.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Confirmed diagnosis of primary CAgD
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Confirmed diagnosis of primary CAgD based on the following criteria: a) Chronic hemolysis b) Polyspecific direct antiglobulin test (DAT) positive c) Monospecific DAT strongly positive for C3d d) Cold agglutinin titer ≥64 at 4℃ e) IgG DAT ≤1+, and f) No overt malignant disease

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Transfusion history
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: History of at least one documented blood transfusion within 6 months of enrollment.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Hemoglobin level
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Hemoglobin level ≤10.0 g/dL.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Bilirubin level
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Bilirubin level above the normal reference range, including patients with Gilbert’s Syndrome.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Ferritin levels
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Ferritin levels above the lower limit of normal. Concurrent treatment with iron supplementation is permitted if the patient has been on a stable dose during the previous 4 weeks.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: CAgD-related signs or symptoms
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Presence of one or more of the following CAgD-related signs or symptoms within 3 months of Screening: a) Symptomatic anemia defined as: i. Fatigue ii. Weakness iii. Shortness of breath iv. Palpitations, fast heart beat v. Light headedness and/or vi. Chest pain b) Acrocyanosis c) Raynaud’s syndrome d) Hemoglobinuria e) Disabling circulatory symptoms, and/or f) Major adverse vascular event (including thrombosis).

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Bone marrow biopsy
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Bone marrow biopsy within 6 months of Screening with no overt evidence of lymphoproliferative disease or other hematological malignancy. An additional bone marrow biopsy will be required if the prior bone marrow is deemed unsuitable for analysis by the Sponsor.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Vaccinations
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Documented vaccinations against encapsulated bacterial pathogens (Neisseria meningitis, including serogroup B meningococcus where available, Haemophilus influenzae, and Streptococcus pneumoniae) within 5 years of enrollment or as specified in Section 6.1.1.1.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: IV access
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Adequate IV access.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Female contraception
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: If female, must be post-menopausal, surgically sterile, or be established on (≥3 months prior to Screening) and agree to continue to use the same highly effective methods of birth control throughout the study and for 9 weeks following administration of the last dose of study drug.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Male contraception
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Males must be surgically sterile for at least 90 days or when sexually active with female partners of child-bearing potential will agree to use highly effective contraception from Day 0 until 9 weeks following administration of the last dose of study drug.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Informed consent
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Able to comprehend and give informed consent.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Compliance
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Able to comply with the requirements of the study and to complete the full sequence of protocol-related procedures.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Secondary CAS exclusion
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Cold agglutinin syndrome secondary to infection, rheumatologic disease, or active hematologic malignancy.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Clinically relevant infection
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Clinically relevant infection of any kind within the month preceding enrollment (eg, active hepatitis C, pneumonia).

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: SLE or autoimmune disorders
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Clinical diagnosis of systemic lupus erythematosus (SLE) or other autoimmune disorders with anti-nuclear antibodies at Screening. Anti-nuclear antibodies of long-standing duration without associated clinical symptoms will be adjudicated on a case-by-case basis during the Confirmatory Review of Patient Eligibility (Section 6.1.1.3).

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Hepatitis panel
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Positive hepatitis panel (including hepatitis B surface antigen and/or hepatitis C virus antibody) prior to or at Screening.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: HIV antibody
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Positive human immunodeficiency virus (HIV) antibody at Screening.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Rituximab treatment
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Treatment with rituximab monotherapy within 3 months or rituximab combination therapies (eg, with bendamustine, fludarabine, ibrutinib, or cytotoxic drugs) within 6 months prior to enrollment.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Corticosteroids
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Concurrent treatment with corticosteroids other than a stable daily dose equivalent to ≤10 mg/day prednisone for previous 3 months.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Erythropoietin deficiency
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Erythropoietin deficiency. Concurrent treatment with erythropoietin is permitted if the patient has been on a stable dose for the previous 3 months.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Iron supplementation
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Concurrent usage of iron supplementation unless the patient has been on a stable dose for at least 4 weeks.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Significant medical history
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Clinically significant medical history or ongoing chronic illness that would jeopardize the safety of the patient or compromise the quality of the data derived from his/her participation in this study (as determined by the Investigator [or designee]) at Screening.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Experimental drugs
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Concurrent treatment with other experimental drugs or participation in another clinical trial with any investigational drug within 30 days or 5 half-lives, whichever is greater, prior to treatment start.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Pregnancy or lactation
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Females who are pregnant, lactating, or, if having reproductive potential, are considered potentially unreliable with respect to contraceptive practice.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Hypersensitivity
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: History of hypersensitivity to BIVV009 or any of its components.

studyInterventions.name: BIVV009
studyInterventions.description: Humanized monoclonal antibody (mAb) directed against human complement factor C1s.

studyInterventions.name: Blood transfusion
studyInterventions.description: Administered if Hgb <9 g/dL and symptomatic, or Hgb <7 g/dL and asymptomatic.

studyInterventions.name: Iron supplementation
studyInterventions.description: Permitted if patient has been on a stable dose for at least 4 weeks.

studyInterventions.name: Erythropoietin
studyInterventions.description: Permitted if patient has been on a stable dose for the previous 3 months.

studyInterventions.name: Corticosteroids
studyInterventions.description: Permitted only as a stable daily dose equivalent to ≤10 mg/day prednisone for previous 3 months.

studyInterventions.name: Vaccinations against encapsulated bacterial pathogens
studyInterventions.description: Required vaccinations including Neisseria meningitis, Haemophilus influenzae, and Streptococcus pneumoniae.

studyInterventions.name: Rituximab
studyInterventions.description: Prohibited within 3 months (monotherapy) or 6 months (combination therapy) prior to enrollment.

amendments.name: Amendment 06
amendments.summary: The primary reasons for this amendment to Protocol BIVV009-03 (Cardinal) are to extend Part B duration from 1 to 2 years after Last Patient Out from Part A, to provide home infusion facilities to the patients (for US, the Netherlands, Norway, France, Italy, Austria, Germany, and Spain specific amendments), to add new exploratory objective of immunogenicity, to introduce additional time points when samples for ADAs against BIVV009 are collected, to specify that left over PD samples will be used to assess immunogenicity in patients who consented to future use of samples, to introduce additional time points for SLE panel in Part B, and to introduce a correction in Section 10.1 Appendix A.

amendments.name: Amendment 5
amendments.summary: The following corrections or changes were made to the protocol for clarity, consistency, and accuracy: The page headers were updated with Version 5 of the protocol. The abbreviation list was updated. The tables of contents were updated. The Investigator’s and Sponsor’s agreement pages were updated with Version 5 and the date of approval. Minor grammatical and formatting changes were made throughout the protocol. Clarification as to how data corrections would be shown. Changed PK and PD postdose sample collection time from 2 hours to 1 hour postdose.

medicalDevices.label: IV Access
medicalDevices.description: Cannula or catheter for intravenous drug administration

medicalDevices.label: ECG Machine
medicalDevices.description: Device used to record the electrical activity of the heart

conditions.name: Part A Responder Criteria
conditions.description: Criteria for determining treatment success in Part A
conditions.text: No blood transfusion from Week 5 through Week 26 AND (Hgb level >= 12 g/dL OR Hgb increase >= 2 g/dL from baseline) at treatment assessment endpoint.

conditions.name: Dose Level Weight Threshold
conditions.text: Weight < 75 kg receive 6.5 g; Weight >= 75 kg receive 7.5 g.

conditions.name: Home Infusion Eligibility
conditions.description: Criteria to move to home-based dosing
conditions.text: Determined to have tolerated BIVV009 well and qualified by Investigator per Appendix J.

study.name: A PHASE 3, PIVOTAL, OPEN-LABEL, MULTICENTER STUDY TO ASSESS THE EFFICACY AND SAFETY OF BIVV009 IN PATIENTS WITH PRIMARY COLD AGGLUTININ DISEASE WHO HAVE A RECENT HISTORY OF BLOOD TRANSFUSION

administrations.name: BIVV009 Part A Regimen
administrations.doseFrequency: Day 0, Day 7, and every 14 days thereafter

administrations.name: BIVV009 Loading Dose (Missed Dose)
administrations.doseFrequency: Once (1 week prior to next scheduled dose)

substances.name: BIVV009
substances.description: Humanized monoclonal antibody targeting human complement factor C1s

studyDefinitionDocument.name: Cardinal Study: A Phase 3, pivotal, open-label, multicenter study to assess the efficacy and safety of BIVV009 in patients with primary cold agglutinin disease who have a recent history of blood transfusion

transitionRules.name: Part A to Part B Transition
transitionRules.text: Patients who complete Part A per protocol through the EOT visit will participate in Part B.

transitionRules.name: Dose Modification - Loading Dose
transitionRules.text: Should patients deviate from their scheduled dosing, a repeat loading dose may be required.

transitionRules.name: Safety Discontinuation - SLE
transitionRules.text: Clinical signs of SLE or any other immune complex disease.

transitionRules.name: Home Infusion Interruption
transitionRules.text: Return to bi-weekly site dosing if AE occurs that jeopardizes safety during home infusion.

commentAnnotations.text: The name and numbering of the protocol is based on a new numbering system followed by the Sponsor.
Any patient withdrawing from the study after Week 5 and prior to the Week 23 visit will be considered a non-responder.
BIVV009 doses of 6.5 grams (if <75 kg) or 7.5 grams (if ≥75 kg) based on patient’s baseline body weight will be administered via IV infusion
commentAnnotations.sourceSection: Table 3 - Study schedule of events (Footnote i)

commentAnnotations.text: In patients who consented to the use of their blood samples for future research, PD back-up samples collected at the following time points Day 7, 35, 77, 133 and 175, may be used to assay ADA.

studyAmendmentImpacts.affectedSection: Section 1: Synopsis; Section 4.4: Duration of the Study
studyAmendmentImpacts.description: Extension of Part B open-label duration from 1 year to 2 years following Last Patient Out from Part A.

studyAmendmentImpacts.affectedSection: Section 1: Synopsis; Section 6.1.6; Section 10.10: Appendix J
studyAmendmentImpacts.description: Introduction of home infusion facilities for patients in preselected countries.
Addition of immunogenicity (ADA) as a new exploratory objective and endpoint.
Correction of clinical laboratory evaluations by removing specific parameters.
Replacement of statistical terminology (ITT to FAS) and alignment with Sanofi documentation standards.

studyAmendmentReasons.reasonText: Gather more evidence on long-term safety, tolerability and durability of response of BIVV009.
Evaluate the safety and patient satisfaction with the convenience of home infusion.
Comply with Sanofi standards and provide clarification of clinical laboratory evaluations.

studyChanges.beforeText: 1 year following last patient out (LPO) under Part A
studyChanges.afterText: 2 years following last patient out (LPO) under Part A
Exploratory Objectives were added for Part B to describe the safety and patient satisfaction with the convenience of home infusion and to evaluate the immunogenicity of BIVV009.
studyChanges.summary: Added new exploratory objectives for the extension phase.
Removed Iron from the clinical chemistry panel in Appendix A.

studyChanges.afterText: Revaccination with booster doses should be given according to regional guidelines for patients with persistent complement deficiency.
studyChanges.summary: Clarified vaccination requirements for encapsulated bacterial pathogens.

studyChanges.afterText: Hematology panel (beginning at Week 79) and Clinical chemistry panel (beginning at Week 79)
studyChanges.summary: Added assessment frequency for the second year of Part B.
